meanings.definition: The state of being drowsy or sleepy.
meanings.sent1: After a long day of playing outside, the child's doziness was evident as he struggled to keep his eyes open.
meanings.sent2: The doziness that comes after a big meal made him want to take a nap.
meanings.sent3: His doziness during the boring lecture almost caused him to fall off his chair.
meanings.sent4: The doziness of the old library filled the room with a sense of calm and tranquility.
meanings.sent5: The doziness of the cat curled up in the sunbeam was a picture of pure contentment.

meanings.definition: A feeling of laziness or sluggishness.
meanings.sent1: The doziness that overcame him on a rainy day made it hard to get out of bed.
meanings.sent2: Her doziness on a Sunday morning often led to a slow start to the day.
meanings.sent3: The doziness of the sloth hanging from the tree was almost comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The doziness of the computer on a hot day made it frustratingly slow to work.
meanings.sent5: The doziness of the turtle as it moved along the path was a reminder to take things slow.

meanings.definition: A tendency to doze off or fall asleep easily.
meanings.sent1: His doziness in the cozy armchair often resulted in him nodding off during movies.
meanings.sent2: The doziness that came over her after reading a book in bed made her drift off to sleep.
meanings.sent3: The doziness of the baby in the rocking cradle was a sight that brought smiles to everyone's faces.
meanings.sent4: The doziness of the campers around the crackling fire signaled the end of a long day of hiking.
meanings.sent5: The doziness of the train's rhythmic motion lulled passengers into a peaceful slumber.
